job_description: Company: Investment ManagementIntroductionA leading global investment management firm is seeking an experienced Investment Analyst to join their Johannesburg office. This is an exceptional opportunity for you to become a core member of a highly respected investment team, renowned for delivering precision-engineered multi-asset portfolios and pioneering technology solutions for financial professionals. You will be immersed in a collaborative environment that values analytical rigour, entrepreneurial spirit, and teamwork across international offices.The organisation has earned multiple industry awards for its market-leading investment outcomes, client service, and risk-profiling expertise. As an Investment Analyst, you will play a meaningful role in shaping investment strategy, supporting portfolio construction, and driving innovation in product development.Key Qualifications And Experience Required For The Investment AnalystRelevant degree (minimum)CFA / CAIA / CIPM (preferable)3-5 years relevant experienceFinancial Services industry experience (NB)Investment research / fund analysis experienceExposure to multi-asset funds & model portfolios (preferable)Key duties for the Investment AnalystMarket Research & AnalysisFund ResearchInvestment Committee ContributionTeam support & ReportingProduct Development & InnovationConduct comprehensive research on global financial markets, asset classes, and economic indicators to inform portfolio construction and investment strategy.Analyse trends, risks, and opportunities using both quantitative and qualitative methods to support decision-making within the investment team.Prepare detailed research reports and presentations for discussion at the Investment Committee, ensuring clarity and accessibility for diverse stakeholders.Screen potential investment opportunities by evaluating fund managers’ performance, investment processes, team stability, and cost efficiency through rigorous due diligence.Maintain structured monitoring of selected funds with regular performance reviews and attribution analysis to ensure ongoing suitability within portfolios.Provide research-driven input into asset allocation decisions and assist in preparing briefing materials for committee meetings.Support documentation of discussions, decisions, and the evolution of ongoing strategies within the investment function.Collaborate closely with colleagues in Johannesburg and London on cross-team initiatives such as technology development, product design, and reporting improvements.Prepare high-quality written reports and presentations for both internal teams and external stakeholders, translating complex financial analysis into accessible insights.Contribute ideas to product development by staying informed about industry innovations and supporting the delivery of new investment products and services.Key SkillsDemonstrated analytical ability with strong quantitative skillsProficiency in using investment research tools such as Bloomberg or Morningstar Broad understanding of global financial markets including asset classes and various investment products relevant to multi-asset portfolios.Excellent written and verbal communication skills enabling you to translate complex financial concepts into clear insights for diverse audiences.Experience collaborating effectively within multi-location teams while contributing positively to shared goals.High ethical standards with proven integrity in handling sensitive information related to investments.Exceptional attention to detail combined with intellectual curiosity that drives continuous learning within the field of investments.Ability to manage multiple priorities independently while maintaining accuracyUnderstanding of both South African and UK financial services landscapes is desirable**Please note that this is a fully in office-based role, in Johannesburg**This is an excellent opportunity to gain entry into a reputable global asset management firm.What's NextIf you are ready to take your career further by joining a globally respected team dedicated to precision investment management, apply today by clicking on the link provided. company_name: Eastgate Software - We Drive Digital Transformation
job_description: Founded in 2014, Eastgate Software is a software development company that builds custom business solutions and applications. We are proud of our high-qualified staff who has more than 20 years of experience in software development including web, mobile and desktop applications.We put quality and customer satisfactions at the top priority in every project we carry. Therefore, our German and US senior experts offer local consultancy for European and US clients.As a member of Eastgate, you will be emerged in a professional and flexible environment where you have opportunities to express your own ideas and improve your skill set through many interesting full-cycle projects.Your responsibilities:- Work as a Business Analyst in an Agile environment, collaborating closely with Product Owners, developers, QA, and stakeholders- Envision and analyze initial business requirements and support the definition of the initial project scope- Gather, analyze, and translate business needs into user stories, acceptance criteria, and functional specifications- Document business and functional requirements using appropriate artifacts such as wireframes, user stories, activity diagrams, use cases, and process flows- Support requirements planning, elicitation, analysis, validation, and lifecycle management in alignment with BABOK best practices- Facilitate effective communication between the development team and customers regarding implementation, QA issues, and requirement clarifications- Support UAT activities, including test preparation, defect clarification, and validation of implemented requirements- Prepare and maintain BA-related documentation, such as Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM), user manuals, and UAT/training materialsWith Senior Level:- Define the Business Analysis approach for each project, including elicitation techniques, documentation standards, and stakeholder engagement strategy- Plan and manage the requirements phase at the beginning of the project, including scope definition, prioritization, and risk identification- Lead and facilitate requirements elicitation workshops and stakeholder review sessions- Analyze business processes, user workflows, and system interactions to identify gaps and improvement opportunities- Document detailed and high-quality business requirements, ensuring clarity, consistency, and testability- Manage requirement changes, perform impact analysis, and support change control throughout the project lifecycle- Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements and analysis artifacts to ensure quality and alignment- Provide coaching and training to junior team members and prepare training materials as needed The ideal candidate:- 3–5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Owner, with strong practical knowledge of BABOK and Business Analysis best practices- Proven experience in requirements planning, elicitation, analysis, validation, and lifecycle management- Strong skills in stakeholder management, requirements prioritization, and change control- Ability to model business processes, functional flows, and system interactions- Experience supporting UAT, solution validation, and post-release evaluation- In-depth experience with at least one prototyping tool (e.g., Balsamiq, Figma); experience with modeling tools is an advantage- Good command of English, especially spoken English- Domain knowledge in Logistics or Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) is an advantageWhy you’ll love working at Eastgate:- Attractive salary and bonus package.- Eastgate Software is a Global Fortune 500 Preferred Vendor, so you will have an opportunity to work with many IT Experts around Europe and USA.- Be emerged in a professional and motivating environment where you have opportunities to express your ideas and improve your skill set through many interesting full-cycle projects.- Flexible working time: 9:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m., Monday to Friday, No Overtime (Only 8 working hours)- Performance review and appropriate gratification: twice a year.- 13th month salary + Project Bonus + 02 probationary months with full salary.- Extra health check package per year.- 12 paid leave days/year (add an extra day each year and a maximum 20 days for annual leave) + 04 days for studying purpose.- Free snacks, video gaming & movie nights, team social and sports activities. This role serves as a trusted liaison between the CEO, leadership teams, external stakeholders, and group-level functions, ensuring information flows with discretion, accuracy, and professionalism. Key responsibilities include managing the CEO’s calendar, travel logistics, and executive correspondence with strong attention to detail and confidentiality. The role involves coordinating cross-functional meetings, supporting board-level preparations, handling documentation processes, and tracking key follow-ups and deadlines. communication for executive visits, internal events, and corporate gatheringsProvide support in documentation workflows including reporting, approvals, digital archiving, and purchasing requestsPartner with relevant teams to ensure accurate and timely delivery of materials, signatures, and decision support documentsContribute to a positive and inclusive office environment by supporting internal celebrations, protocol arrangements, and executive-level hospitalityTake part in budget-related administrative tasks such as invoice processing, corporate gifts, expense tracking, and system entriesSupport selected operational processes in collaboration with administrative services, IT, finance, and HR functionsThis position requires a detail-oriented, agile, and we looking for in this position?Bachelor’s degreeExperience in executive-level administrative roles within a corporate or multinational environmentDemonstrated capability in handling sensitive and confidential information with sound judgmentStrong planning, prioritization, and time management skills with excellent attention to detailExcellent command of English, both written and verbalProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with modern business tools and systemsStrong interpersonal and communication skills, with a collaborative and inclusive approachComfort Join Inchcape Indonesia, part of Inchcape’s global network.You’ll play a key part in delivering great experiences for our customers and colleagues. With lots of interesting opportunities and challenges for you to explore that will take us, and your progression, to the next level.Our Finance department is seeking a Fixed Assets to join our team in Wanaherang, West Java. In this position you will be responsible for external and internal reporting related to investment activities (Actual Reporting). To ensure accuracy compliance and completeness of fixed asset related supporting document, physic asset and filling.What you’ll do:Capitalization of new Fixed Asset in SAP system, supported with completes the support document with Purchase Request and Purchase Order, invoice and other documentation of fixed asset.Control and monitor the additional amount of Fixed Asset in G/L account in SAP (based on Commercial, Fiscal, National and DAG classification).Ensure that the running depreciation done every month end in SAP system.Maintain the disposal of retirement of Fixed Asset in SAP system.Prepared the retirement report of fixed asset monthly.Cooperate with Sales team check the accurate data and physical check to perform write off Fixed Asset.Prepare additional report of fixed asset report year to date for commercial report and fiscal report accordance to request from Auditor.Ensure the identification of all fixed asset has been recorded in SAP.Provide the several samples of fixed asset report including supporting report if necessary needed by AuditorPrepare reconciliation report between G/L report and SAP report.About you:Bachelor’s Degree in AccountingProfessional certifications (preferred but not mandatory): Brevet A & B (Tax)Strong understanding of fixed asset accounting, including capitalization, depreciation, impairment, and disposal.Experience in internal and external reporting related to investment activities.Strong capability in document control, filing, and audit-ready documentation.Ability to manage and validate supporting documents (invoices, contracts, asset registers).High level of accuracy and attention to detail.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Start your journeyIf you’re excited about this role but don’t meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You might be the perfect fit we’re looking for. Join our team and become part of a leading global automotive company that is transforming tomorrow, together.Opportunity for everyoneInchcape actively encourages applicants from all identities, backgrounds, and experiences, helping ensure our workforce is representative of the global communities we operate in.About usInchcape is the leading global automotive distributor operating in 38 markets. We partner with some of the biggest brands in the business to sustainably power better mobility today and in the future.Our diverse global team of over 16,000 talented colleagues foster an inclusive and collaborative culture, delivering a brilliant experience for our customers and partners. job_description: Incubeta - who are we?Incubeta was founded in 2001 and currently consists of 22 offices and over 800 team members. We’re an international team of experts in marketing, technology, data and creative, who came together because we want businesses to make the most of the opportunities the digital landscape provides. Our core values are: “Exceed Expectations, Dare to Lead, Earn Trust and Help Others Succeed.” To find out more about Incubeta, please visit our website.The Internship RoleThe internship position should be fulfilled for a 9 month period, thereafter a review will take place during which the possibility of a permanent offer will be discussed. This depends on both the intern's performance over the course of the internship as well as the availability of a permanent position at this timeThe main role of the Paid Media Intern is to engage in all aspects of our client activities in terms of performance marketing with a specific focus on, but not limited to: campaign and account management of social, search, and display campaigns. Our training programme will provide a holistic overview to the Digital Marketing landscape and include practical assignments to allow for learning to be embedded throughout the 9 month period. Professional Development & Certification As part of your journey in the Digital Academy, you will be empowered to complete key industry certifications (such as Google Ads, Meta Blueprint, and more). This not only ensures you are learning at a world-class standard but also directly contributes to Incubeta’s status as a top-tier global partner. We are committed to your growth and will provide the time and resources for you to become a certified expert in your field. Role and responsibilitiesWorking closely with team members to assist with quality control/assuranceAssist fellow team members with campaign setups. Ensuring sufficient research is done and following directions given by the media manager/line manager. Support team members with reporting and presentation requirements Analysing campaign performance and providing optimisation suggestions as well as deriving insights and sharing this with the relevant media manager/line manager. Regular reviews of performance of campaigns across revenue, performance and daily pacing. To provide feedback to the relevant media manager/line manager on performance. Monitoring campaigns to ensure performance goals and revenue objectives are met. Assist with ad hoc tasks.Paid Media: SocialEmploy Strategic Campaign set up with sufficient research and following direction given by the strategic lead.Working closely with internal and external stakeholders,account managers and clients to develop and implement media buying strategies.Analyse campaign performance and make recommendations for optimization.Regular review of performance of campaigns across revenue,performance and pacing.Ensure campaign delivery against revenue goals and Key Performance Indicators as established with the client and consultants.Daily reporting and monitoring of campaigns to ensure performance goals and revenue objectives are met.To ensure best practice and buying techniques are employed at all times.Being able to interpret data and deliver a holistic overview to clients.Paid Media: SearchRunning, implementing & managing Google Ads and potentially Microsoft Advertising campaigns.Optimising Paid Per Click (PPC) campaigns based on best practices and up-to-date optimisation techniques.Conducting keyword research, client research & competitive landscape analysis.Overall account creation & set up.Ongoing optimization & strategic feedback.Performance - Ensure campaign targets are met (e.g. CPA / ROAS).Client & Internal Reporting for both operational & invoicing purposes.Assisting team members with quality assurance.Campaign ManagerWorking closely with the Tech and Service team to ensure seamless integration with full Google Marketing Platform (GMP) stack clients.Being able to troubleshoot issues within CM and presenting solutions.Ability to check different channel behaviour and impact of various channels on digital campaign performance eg. How does paid search influence performance on display / social.Essential RequirementsRelevant tertiary qualification related to the role. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English.Passionate about digital marketing.Tech-savvy and quick learner.Resourceful, eager to learn and takes initiative.Excellent time management and strong ability to work well within a team and self managed environment.Key Competencies and Work EthicQuality and service conscious.Solution-oriented and with a positive attitude.Ability to handle high-pressure situations and tight deadlines.Ability to be entrepreneurial and to create own opportunities.Able to spot and raise up- and cross-selling opportunities. Proactive thinking.Ability to succeed in a fast paced, forward-thinking environment. Diligent and able to work independently. Strong organisational and problem solv

job_description: bout Turing:Based in San Francisco, California, Turing is the world’s leading research accelerator for frontier AI labs and a trusted partner for global enterprises deploying advanced AI systems.Turing supports customers in two ways: first, by accelerating frontier research with high-quality data, advanced training pipelines, plus top AI researchers who specialize in coding, reasoning, STEM, multilinguality, multimodality, and agents; and second, by applying that expertise to help enterprises transform AI from proof of concept into proprietary intelligence with systems that perform reliably, deliver measurable impact, and drive lasting results on the P&LAbout the Role:We are looking for a detail-oriented Business Analyst to support evaluation and annotation workflows focused on quality, accuracy, and structured reasoning. fact-checking.Responsibilities:Perform side-by-side (SxS) evaluations on GHD, comparing outputs and assessing quality, accuracy, and relevance.Conduct fact-checking to validate information and identify inconsistencies or inaccuracies.Provide detailed, well-structured justifications to support evaluation decisions.Follow established evaluation guidelines and quality standards consistently.Use browser-based tools and extensions to support analysis and review tasks.Execute simple command-line instructions when required to support evaluation workflows.Document findings clearly and communicate insights to stakeholders when needed.Requirements:Solid comfort using a computer in a professional setting.Experience working with browser extensions and online tools.Ability to run basic command-line commands (no advanced programming required).Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.High attention to detail and ability to justify decisions clearly and objectively.Comfortable working with evaluation frameworks, comparisons, and structured analysis.Good written communication skills in English.Nice to Have:Previous experience with evaluation, annotation, QA, or audit-type work.Familiarity with data quality, content evaluation, or model/output assessments.Background in business analysis, operations, or process improvement.Perks of Freelancing With Turing:Competitive compensation based on experience and expertise.Flexible working hours and a fully remote environment.Opportunity to contribute to impactful research initiatives.Potential for contract extension based on performance and project needs.Offer Details:Commitment Required: 30 hours per week minimum.Engagement Type: Contractor/Freelancer (no medical or paid leave).Time Overlap: Some overlap with UTC-8:00 (2–5 hrs/day) America/Los_Angeles.Application Process:Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete an analytical challenge.Once the assessment is cleared, you’re ready to start contributing!After applying, you will receive an email with a login link. Please use that link to access the portal and complete your profile.Know amazing talent? Refer them at turing.com/referrals, and earn money from your network. Show more Show less

Socium est une startup innovante qui se spécialise dans la création de solutions de ressources humaines (RH) sur mesure, adaptées aux entreprises opérant en Afrique. Avec des bureaux situés dans des villes stratégiques telles que Dakar, Abidjan, Douala et Casablanca, nous offrons nos services à des clients dans 11 pays sur le continent, garantissant une approche locale adaptée à chaque spécificité.Notre système d'information de gestion des ressources humaines (SIRH) comprend divers outils tels que :Gestion complète du recrutement grâce à un applicant tracking system (ATS).Gestion de la paie.Gestion des workflows (congés, avances sur salaires, notes de frais, et demandes de moyens).Évaluation de la performance (GPEC).Gestion des documents.Description principale du poste :En tant qu'Account Executive chez Socium, vous jouerez un rôle stratégique en développant et en gérant des relations avec des comptes internationaux clés. Vous serez responsable de la génération de nouvelles opportunités commerciales, de la négociation et de la conclusion de contrats complexes avec des clients globaux ( petites, moyennes et grandes entreprises). Votre mission sera d'accroître les revenus de l'entreprise en atteignant les objectifs de vente, tout en assurant un service client exceptionnel et en cultivant des relations solides et durables avec des clients mondiaux.Responsabilités du poste :Commercial :Atteindre ou dépasser les objectifs trimestrielsTravailler en étroite collaboration avec le CCO pour identifier, approcher et convertir les entreprises à fort potentielIdentifier les décisionnaires et les convaincre de passer sur SociumReprésenter l'entreprise lors d'événements et de conférences de l'industrie pour élargir le réseau et générer des leadsDévelopper de solides relations avec les clientsStratégieContribuer à l'amélioration continue de la stratégie de vente et des processus de vente de SociumDévelopper des connaissances sur l’écosystème Tech HR (Africain et Européen) et savoir présenter efficacement notre solution aux interlocuteurs dédiésSe tenir informé des tendances de l'industrie, du paysage concurrentiel et des fonctionnalités et mises à jour de nos produits.Fournir des mises à jour et des rapports réguliers sur les activités de vente, le pipeline et les performances.Collaborer avec les équipes Produit, Marketing, Customer Success pour assurer une satisfaction client élevéeAméliorer continuellement ses connaissances sur les produits et les techniques de vente grâce à des formations continues et au développement professionnelProfil recherchéDiplômes et Formations Requis :Bac+3 en commerce, gestion des affaires, marketing ou dans un domaine connexe.Expérience Exigée :Minimum 5 ans d'expérience dans un poste similaire, de préférence dans un environnement SaaS ou technologique.Compétences Requises :Expertise avérée dans l'atteinte et le dépassement des objectifs de vente.Compétences en négociation et en conclusion de ventes, avec la capacité de naviguer dans des cycles de vente complexes.Excellentes compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles, avec la capacité de bâtir des relations de confiance avec des décideurs clés.Autonomie et motivation personnelle avec une forte éthique de travail et la capacité à travailler de manière indépendante.Compétences analytiques pour évaluer les performances et proposer des optimisations.Maîtrise des logiciels CRM et des outils d'automatisation des ventes.Passion pour les produits techniques complexes et les comptes de grande taille.Capacité à travailler en équipe jusqu'à la signature (réponses aux appels d'offres, équipe projet, équipe technique...).Forte capacité d'adaptation et de résistance à l'échec dans un environnement de start-up dynamique.Soft Skills Requises :Capacité à travailler efficacement avec des équipes interfonctionnelles.Compétence pour communiquer clairement et efficacement avec les différentes parties prenantes.Capacité à s'adapter aux changements et à l'ambiguïté dans un environnement dynamique.Aptitude à identifier, analyser et résoudre efficacement les problèmes.Habileté à gérer efficacement son temps et à prioriser les tâches pour respecter les échéances.Focus sur la satisfaction client et compréhension des besoins des utilisateurs. Safeguarding Integrity, Managing Risk.Role description:The Senior Risk Analyst plays a critical role in safeguarding the integrity and functionality of ARRISE's operations. This position requires a proactive professional with deep expertise in risk and fraud analysis, particularly within the iGaming sector. The role involves close collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, data-driven decision-making, and acting as shift leader when needed, ensuring seamless operations and risk mitigation at all times.Responsibilities:Monitor and detect high-risk or fraudulent player activity during Live Casino sessions.Ensure proper functioning and integrity of Live Casino tables, tools, and equipment.Analyse player behavior and betting patterns, taking action in line with internal protocols.Compile and interpret data from various sources to perform detailed risk assessments.Review POSITION SUMMARY:This position is responsible for the Financial Accounting & Analysis in the Shawflex business segment. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:1. Prepare and entry of month end transactions into general ledger via journal vouchers. 2. Perform balance sheet analysis and assist Financial Controller in other month end closing processes.3. Maintain the Fixed Asset Database by ensuring all items entered in the general ledger for additions and disposals are recorded on the perpetual ledger and maintaining the Fixed Assets Module in IFS.4. Prepare and remit GST, HST, QST, and WSIB on a monthly basis.5. Reconcile all bank accounts and all other balance sheet accounts (Sundry Receivable, Prepaid, Accrued Liabilities, etc.) on a monthly basis.6. Prepare and review impact of foreign exchange on the translation of cash and intercompany accounts with Senior Financial Analyst (SFA).7. Perform inter-company reconciliations and assist with coding of the invoices. 8. Perform upload of monthly financials into Onestream, LV7 (Consolidation Software) & SharePoint.9. Preparation of periodical tax & insurance packages for submission to internal & external stakeholders.10. Assist in extracting & providing data for quarterly & annual internal & external audits.11. Investigate departmental financials at the request of users.12. Assist Finance Controller/SFA with other ad-hoc accounting and data analytical requests.13. Prepare & ensure appropriate process documentation. REQUIREMENTS:Minimum 3 years experience in similar role within general accounting.Holding a Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting - must.CPA or currently in progress - preferred.Previous experience in Manufacturing industry - preferred. Technical Accounting Skills – strong knowledge of GAAP/IFRS and full-cycle accounting. - MustFinancial Analysis – ability to analyze balance sheet accounts and variances. - MustReconciliation Skills – accurate and timely bank and account reconciliations. - Must Tax Knowledge – understanding of GST/HST/QST and other regulatory filings. - PreferredERP & Financial Systems – experience with accounting/ERP software (e.g., IFS, Onestream, SAP, Oracle) and proficiency in Excel. - MustAttention to Detail & Accuracy – ensuring completeness and compliance in financial records.Problem-Solving & Investigative Skills – ability to identify, research, and resolve discrepancies.Time Management & Organization – managing multiple deadlines during month-end and audits.Communication Skills – effectively liaising with internal teams, auditors, banks, and regulatory bodies.Process Documentation – ability to create and maintain accounting process documentation.Team Collaboration – working closely with finance colleagues and cross-functional departments.Adaptability – flexibility to support ad-hoc requests and shifting priorities. job_description: Power, Energy and Oil Sector is looking for Chief Financial Officer (CFO)Job Description / ResponsibilityJob ContextThe CFO will serve as a key member of the senior leadership team, responsible for steering the organization’s overall financial management and growth strategy. The ideal candidate will ensure robust financial governance, optimize capital structure, drive innovative financing solutions, and maintain compliance with both local and international standards.Key ResponsibilitiesLead strategic financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting for all business units including LPG, CNG, power, oil tanker, coal transportation, and real estate operations.Develop, implement, and oversee efficient accounting systems and internal financial controls to ensure transparency and accuracy.Supervise financial reporting, taxation, auditing, and treasury operations in compliance with IFRS/IAS, the Companies Act, BSEC, and VAT & Tax Ordinances.Prepare and monitor the annual budget and capital plan, analyze variances, and propose corrective actions for improved performance.Design and execute funding strategies for business expansion including syndicated loans, preferential shares, project financing, swaps, and IPO/Non-IPO initiatives.Drive revenue generation plans through creative financing and operational efficiency models aligned with the company’s strategic objectives.Manage financial risks, ensuring effective mitigation of market, operational, and compliance-related risks within the energy sector.Collaborate closely with the Managing Director/CEO and Senior Management Team to optimize capital structure, ROI, and cost control measures.Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing finance and accounting team, fostering integrity, accountability, and continuous improvement.Maintain strong relationships with banks, investors, regulatory authorities, and key financial stakeholders.Educational RequirementsMaster of Business Administration (MBA) in FinanceProfessional certification is mandatory — CPA, CA, CMA, CFA, ACCA, or CIA. (Applicants without one of these certifications will not be considered.)A Master’s degree or MBA in Finance will be an added advantage.Skills Required: Accounts and FinanceExperience Requirements10 to 15 year(s)The applicants should have experience in the following business area(s):PowerAdditional RequirementsExperience RequirementsAt least 10 years of relevant experience in Finance, Accounting, and Strategic Planning.At least 3–5 years of experience in a senior leadership role (preferably as CFO/Head of Finance) in a large-scale manufacturing, oil & gas, real estate, or energy sector organization.Proven expertise in arranging syndicated loans, equity funding, and financing large-scale projects with local and international financial institutions.Experience in organizations with annual turnover exceeding BDT 100 crore is preferred.Other RequirementsStrong knowledge of Bangladesh’s financial and regulatory frameworks, including BSEC guidelines, IFRS/IAS standards, corporate tax and VAT laws.Excellent analytical, strategic, and problem-solving abilities.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, or similar), and financial modeling tools.Exceptional communication and presentation skills in English, knowledge of additional languages is an advantage.High level of integrity, confidentiality, and interpersonal leadership. job_description: At Principal, we invest in what matters. And building dedicated teams is where it all begins. We’re drawn to people who bring outstanding perspectives, passion, and expertise to help us advance the financial security and well-being of our customers. We also aim to transform our growing business and drive positive change in the communities where we live and work.When we invest in you, and you invest in us, great things happen.We are looking for a Manager/ Senior Manager, Internal Audit who will lead our internal audit team for the Southeast Asia region. This role requires flexibility to travel up to 20% of the time, depending on project needs.What You’ll DoExecute financial, operational, and/or information systems audits in accordance with the Company’s audit methodology and accepted professional standards. Perform in-depth analyses of business processes and risks. Modify the scope and/or approach as necessary to focus resources on the most significant areas. Assure reviews are completed on time and within budget. Adequately document audit procedures and results, and appraise adequacy of the corrective action taken to improve deficient conditionsCommunicate results of analysis. Facilitate discussions of best practices internally and externally. Negotiate with auditees to develop action plans to address control deficiencies. Provide accurate and complete information to auditees and other stakeholders on the state of business risks and status of action plans.Network with business management and stay current on key business initiatives. Proactively promote wide understanding within the organization about risks and control strategies.Identify and escalate any strategic implications and/or best practices to the organization based on audit findings. Based on analysis of the alternatives, provide recommendations for the optimal course of action for the operation.Perform other job-related duties and special projects as required.Who You AreBachelor’s or Master’s degree holder in Accounting and Finance or other related fields. Professional accounting qualification(s) such as ACCA, CPA, etc. is mandatory.At least 7 to 10 years of experience in both Big 4 audit firm(s) and commercial organization(s), particularly in audit, risk, fraud, investigations, and/or forensic audit function.Expertise in internal control auditing and/or a good understanding of a pension, mutual funds, insurance, banking or other business within the financial services industry.Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability and confidence to articulate insights and recommendations effectively.Effective project management skills.Ability to lead and coach a team and also be able to work well as a team member.A proven track record of delivering insightful and impactful audit reports to senior management.Strong analytical skills and willingness to keep up with industry, regulatory developments and learn new concepts and methods.Language proficiency in English and Mandarin.Who We ArePrincipal Financial Group is a Fortune 500 global leader in financial services specializing in insurance, retirement, and asset management. We have 18,000 employees and 51 million customers around the world with over $714B in assets under management. Show more Show less

job_description: We enhance performance through creating risk-enabled organizations. We help clients identify important risks, design frameworks to manage them and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of risk management. As a risk transformation professional, you will be addressing client issues such as business performance variability, business and process controls transformation and automation; application security integrity, governance, risk and control (GRC) technology enablement, business and/or IT GRC, continuous monitoring, vendor and contract risk management, IT risk management as well as to support and manage technology risk audits. You will belong to an international network of specialists helping our clients transform risk functions and implement technology solutions that support risk management and governance.We will support you with career-long training and coaching to develop your skills in risk strategy, risk function design, risk management and performance enhancement. As EY is a global leading service provider in this space, you will be working with the best of the best in a collaborative environment. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.The opportunity You will be responsible for managing multiple client engagement teams at an executive level within the practice and the firm. Engagements focus on the assessment and/or evaluation of IT systems and the mitigation of IT-related business risks. Engagements may be either assurance (attestation) and/or risk consulting in nature, and vary considerably in size and complexity.All of our Technology Risk services whether assurance or consulting in nature are designed for the dual purpose of strengthening internal controls and, in so doing, helping to improve IT and business performance.In addition to assurance-related engagements such as financial attestation and ISAE 3402 engagements, you will focus on IT governance and effectiveness; IT program management and assurance; security and controls of ERP implementations; and business intelligence and information analysis.As a Manager within the Technology Risk team, you will provide guidance and share knowledge with team members and participate in performing procedures especially focusing on complex, judgmental and/or specialized issues.You will work with the team and the client to create plans for accomplishing engagement objectives and a strategy that complies with professional standards and addresses the risks inherent in the engagement.Your key responsibilities • Brief the engagement team on the client's IT environment and industry IT trends• Maintain relationships with client management to manage expectations of service, including work products, timing, and deliverables• Demonstrate a thorough understanding of complex information systems and apply it to client situations• Use extensive knowledge of the client's business/industry to identify technological developments and evaluate impacts on the client's business• Demonstrate excellent project management skills, inspire teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members• Use current technology/tools to enhance the effectiveness of deliverables and servicesSkills and attributes for success • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills• Strong drive to excel professionally, and to guide and motivate others• Advanced written and verbal communication skills• Dedicated, innovative, resourceful, and able to work under pressure• Foster an efficient, innovative and team-oriented work environmentTo qualify for the role you must have • A recognized university degree in accounting, business, information technology, engineering, mathematics or other relevant discipline• At least 5 years of relevant IT audit, consulting or industry experience, preferably in a professional services environment or MNC.• Significant experience in having applied relevant technical knowledge in at least one of the following engagements:(a) financial statement audits;(b) internal or operational audits;(c) ISAE 3402 engagements;(d) ERP security and controls reviews (Oracle, SAP, PeopleSoft)(e) SOX integrated audits and/or(f) application of data analytics for business process reviews (e.g., ACL, IDEAL, SQL, Tableau, Spotfire)• Strong project management skills and able to manage a portfolio of engagements• Ability to identify and cross sell services within the firm to existing clienteleIdeally, you should also have • Professional certification e.g. CPA, CA, CISA, CISSP, CISM, COBIT, ISMS, CBCP, CIA, CIPP, CGEIT, CIPM or CIPP certification or other related certifications• Experience in financial institutions (i.e. banking, insurance, wealth/asset management etc.)• Knowledge in central bank regulatory framework• Strong grasp of business and technical issues and industry trendsWhat we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. job_description: Role Overview: As a Business-Focused Data Governance Analyst, you'll be the key link between Data Governance teams and business stakeholders, ensuring effective implementation and ongoing improvement of data governance practices. Your responsibilities will focus on aligning data requirements, governance frameworks, stakeholder engagement, and optimizing processes across the organization.Key Responsibilities:Business Governance ExecutionLead the identification, definition, and approval of Critical Data Elements (CDEs) across domains.Oversee updates to the business glossary for accurate, consistent definitions.Manage the data quality (DQ) lifecycle, addressing issues, prioritizing tasks, and conducting root cause analysis.Maintain business-facing data lineage, ensuring it aligns with technical data lineage.Stakeholder Engagement & Governance ForumsSupport governance groups by preparing materials, agendas, and status updates.Track action items, decisions, and escalations, ensuring follow-up.Serve as a trusted advisor to Data Owners and Stewards on governance best practices.Process, Operating Model & DocumentationDevelop and maintain governance documentation, including SOPs and playbooks.Ensure consistent application of governance standards across the business.Support change management and readiness for governance initiatives.Analyze business processes to understand the impact on data flow.Adoption & EnablementDrive adoption of governance tools, processes, and workflows.Provide training and onboarding to Data Owners, Stewards, and SMEs.Track compliance metrics and support governance maturity efforts.Identify gaps in adoption and suggest improvements.Skills & Qualifications:Strong understanding of data governance principles (CDEs, data quality, lineage, stewardship).Experience facilitating business discussions and translating requirements into governance practices.Familiarity with data governance tools, with preference for Google Data Catalog (but not required).6-10+ years of experience in data governance, business analysis, or operations.Bachelor's degree in Business, Data Management, or related field. job_description: ASAI Management Services Limited is looking for Jr. Implementation EngineerJob Description / ResponsibilityASA International is one of the world’s largest and fastest growing international microfinance banking institutions offering socially responsible loans to underbanked, low-income female micro-entrepreneurs in Asia and Africa (“ASA International” or the “Group”). ASA International promotes financial inclusion and has successfully shown that access to financial services helps to reduce poverty and promotes social-economic progress for its predominantly female client base. ASA International has a premium listing on the main market of the London Stock Exchange and serves close to 2.3 million customers across 13 countries in Asia and Africa. It has corporate head offices in Amsterdam, the Netherlands as well as in Dhaka, Bangladesh. ASA International provides small loans ranging from USD 250 to USD 2,000. Almost all customers are women that run small businesses, from small shops, restaurants, sewing businesses, to various trading activities and cottage industries. Increasing financial inclusion and promoting social and economic development of our clients and their communities is at the heart of ASA International’s mission.Troubleshoot and resolve technical and business inquiries related to product implementation, training, and user issues.Communicate solutions clearly to clients via phone, email, or remote sessions.Collaborate with teams to report bugs, prioritize issues, and find effective solutions.Assist clients with optimal utilization of software tools and provide technical support throughout project implementation.Execute site procedures and configure applications based on predefined task lists.Ideas about business, technical documentation, and user manual preparationAbility to perform impact analysis and apply strong analytical thinkingEducational RequirementsBachelor of Science (BSc) in Computer Science & EngineeringSkills Required: SQL, Microsoft SQL ServerExperience RequirementsAt most 3 year(s)The applicants should have experience in the following business area(s): Software CompanyAdditional RequirementsBasic Knowledge of SQL Server, including query generation and data maintenance.Knowledgebase in Server-side configuration (Application & Database) is advanced.Familiarity with Visio or similar tools for template and prototype documentation.Continuously expand product knowledge and stay updated with new technologies.Impact Analysis, analytical ability, Client handling.Able to work independently & under pressure.Maintain a positive attitude and willingness to take on new challenges.Confident in client interaction and relationship management.Excellent verbal and written communication skills in EnglishJob LocationDhakaSalaryTk. 30000 - 45000 (Monthly) Show more Show less

clearly and communicate insights to stakeholders when needed.Requirements:Solid comfort using a computer in a professional setting.Experience working with browser extensions and online tools.Ability annotation, QA, or audit-type work.Familiarity with data quality, content evaluation, or model/output assessments.Background in business analysis, operations, or process improvement.Perks of
